meanings.definition: Practice or repeat in preparation for a public performance.
meanings.sent1: She rehearses her lines every day before the play.
meanings.sent2: The band rehearses their songs before the concert.
meanings.sent3: The cat rehearses its meows before waking up its owner.
meanings.sent4: The sun rehearses its rise every morning, painting the sky with colors.
meanings.sent5: The student rehearses the speech in front of the mirror to improve.

meanings.definition: To practice a play, piece of music, or other work for later public performance.
meanings.sent1: He rehearses the dance routine with his partner.
meanings.sent2: The actors rehearse the scene to get it perfect.
meanings.sent3: The robot rehearses its movements before the big show.
meanings.sent4: The river rehearses its flow, shaping the landscape over time.
meanings.sent5: The choir rehearses the song repeatedly to harmonize better.
